newsitem.title: LUXEMBOURG: Germany offers to host global Internet conference.
newsitem.headline: Germany offers to host global Internet conference.

text.p: Germany offered on Tuesday to host an international conference to discuss ways to prevent the misuse of the Internet and other information networks.

Germany told European Union industry ministers at a meeting in Luxembourg that the conference should tackle issues such as privacy, licensing of services, intellectual property, pornography and security of information, according to a text made available to reporters.

The text, presented by German Economics Minister Guenter Rexrodt, said the EU should launch an international initiative to find "a common understanding on means and conditions governing the use of global information networks".
Germany said it would plan the conference in close cooperation with the European Commission. The ministers were set to decide later in the day whether to accept Germany's offer.
